headline: Communications Lead with a focus on impactful content creation and elevating brand presence. Skilled in driving effective communication strategies that deliver measurable results.
summary: I have 8 years of experience in communications and marketing, with a Master‚Äôs in Media and Communication Studies from Lund University as a Swedish Institute scholar. Most recently at Bookboost, a hotel tech startup in Malm√∂, I focused on digital marketing in a B2B setting: managing web content, SEO, and ads to strengthen brand presence and engagement. Previously, I worked with UNOPS and Save the Children, leading global and national campaigns that built awareness and supported organizational goals. My background spans both development and business environments, with a consistent focus on clear messaging, audience engagement, and measurable results.

experience.description: - Manage the social media calendar to deliver consistent, timely, and engaging content. - Analyze marketing channels, including website and social media, to create performance reports and drive data-informed decisions. - Conduct market research, competitor benchmarking, and SEO analysis to refine marketing strategies. - Leverage Google Analytics to track campaign effectiveness, monitor website traffic, and assess user behavior. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop compelling content for social media and web platforms. Show less

* Since November 2023: work remotely to support UNOPS Ukraine in coordination and implementation of communications plans for 12 emergency projects focusing on enabling life to go on and supporting resilient and green infrastructure - Develop and manage calendars of key internal messages to ensure consistent, relevant and timely delivery of internal communication material - Measure the effectiveness of internal communications messages and channels on an ongoing basis and make recommendations to review and amend established processes as appropriate, with particular focus on the analysis of the Intranet and the corporate newsletter - Oversee the content and delivery of the weekly internal newsletter - Ensure that the UNOPS intranet is up-to-date, and that content organization is aligned with agreed governance, and liaise with the different units and groups to implement updates - Advise and train internal communications practitioners to empower them to contribute to the UNOPS communication channels, ensuring alignment with the corporate strategy and branding Key achievements: - Curated & issued 100+ global newsletters to 6000+ personnel with high-quality content - Managed and maintained the Intranet ecosystem with up-to-date 650 pages and executed constant improvements to make it a trusted platform with relevant and accessible information - Utilized Slido as a feedback tool and collected valuable insights for 10 global Town Halls - Established Looker Studio dashboards using Google Analytics to measure the impact of internal communications to global audiences and advise regional offices to develop specific dashboards - Provided 30+ trainings to Intranet technical page owners to keep the content updated on a regular basis, advised on 10+ internal campaigns on content, planning, and delivery Show less

- Provide accurate and up-to-date monthly communications reports for the internal communications team using Data studio with data retrieved from Google Analytics and Mailchimp - Consolidate internal news from various departments including in HQ and the fields, create and send weekly newsletters to all UNOPS personnel via Mailchimp and monitor the traffic for specific data reports - Create intranet news based on available outlines/drafts using plain English for easier understanding - Provide support and guidance regarding intranet governance, reviewing cycle, and other internal communications matters in a timely manner - Provide training to intranet page owners in terms of editorial guidance, governance, reviewing cycle, and intranet vision - Liaise with ICT web developer to support the implementation of intranet improvements - Support the knowledge sharing activities related to community management (knowledge share fairs, regional communications meetings, UN Internal Communications meet-ups) by planning, coordinating with relevant stakeholders and following up on action points - Take charge of the concept note of the digital signage project under an internal communications specialist's supervision Show less

- Lead and manage communication channels, ensuring cohesive messaging and brand consistency across social media, and events - Design and execute marketing strategies to promote events and initiatives, driving increased participation and engagement within the SI NFGL community. - Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to organize impactful events, fostering a network of global leaders and amplifying the SI NFGL‚Äôs mission
experience.company_name: Swedish Institute Network for Future Global Leaders - Lund / SI NFGL Lund

experience.description: - Lead on Save the Children's various campaigns focusing on raising awareness on the education & nutrition issues facing ethnic minority children, climate change issues through facilitating children engagement in raising their voices on such issues, initiating campaign activities, producing social media materials and supporting program teams in organization of high level advocacy events and media collaboration - Produce visually appealing and brand-aligned external marketing materials (photos, videos) for all sectors and programs, including for fundraising purposes - Actively engage the local media to raise Save the Children‚Äôs public profile and spread messages from Save the Children that can help communicate relevant messages and gain acceptance from the general public, partners and beneficiaries - Build capacity of program staff to understand the advocacy, campaign and communications approaches, tools and requirements Key achievements: - Elevated Save the Children's brand awareness on Vietnam's Facebook by a remarkable 275% increase in followers with the assistance of Social Listening tool - Produced COVID-19 response strategy brief for government partners and potential donors - Coordinated and led annual Advocacy Communication Campaign and Media (ACCM) reports to Asia Regional office - Coordinated and advised communications plan for 20+ projects, provided capacity training for 150 staff members and 5 government partners Show less

- Contribute to development and implementation of Save the Children in Vietnam‚Äôs communications strategy and thematic communications plans, with support from the program team - Initiate the content and update Save the Children information on relevant social media channels (Facebook, Instagram) - Support program teams in the development of communications materials (including program brochures, briefs, Country Office information, videos and other promotional products) - Work on organization and implementation of Campaign initiatives, communications and events - Take charge of Every Last Child campaign activities such as ambassador engagement, Bridging the Gap experience, other integrated activities with programme teams - Provide support to program teams to produce and promote case studies and success stories which highlight program achievements - Provide capacity building for program teams in photography and how to write good quality success stories - Coordinate and take initiative to disseminate Save the Children information and materials both internally and externally (including sharing publications, videos and other products within Vietnam) - Provide information to programme teams on Save the Children and donor branding requirements to ensure correct visibility on all publications and materials - Maintain documentation, photographic and video libraries - Provide technical support to production and distribution of Save the Children information packages to corporate sector and potential donors - Produce quality media engagement materials, including media packs, press releases, and information sheets Show less

- Operate "Every Last Child" campaign activities namely KOL ambassador's engagement, video production and other program collaboration to integrate the campaign's message into each project - Produce Country office's communication materials such as brochure, leaflet, infographics, case story - Manage Save the Children's social media channels and create content to reach more target audience

- Admin and Content creator on Japan Foundation‚Äôs website and facebook, monitor the data traffic on Google Analytics - Be the liaison between Japan Foundation and guests, partners with regular updates via Mailchimp - Provide support in organizing Japan Foundation‚Äôs public events: Concerts, Exhibitions, Film Festivals - Manage the center‚Äôs library

recommendations.recommendation: ‚ÄúWe  have been through many internal communications challenges at UNOPS in the past years. With Uyen's leadership  and energy, everything seemed possible and eventually achievable. I can't recommend this young and brave professional enough,  for her empathy and emotional intelligence as well as her reliability and already wide bouquet of solid skills. Lucky the team that can rely on Uyen's support and guidance.‚Äù

projects_topics: Master's thesis "Uncovering the cultural expression and identity of young Vietnamese American through TikTok"
"Coming of age at the rice wine table" - a field work study in Ha Giang, Vietnam

projects.name: Master's thesis "Uncovering the cultural expression and identity of young Vietnamese American through TikTok"
projects.description: This research has been produced during my scholarship period at Lund University, funded by the Swedish Institute. This research explores the cultural representation, identity, and practices of young Vietnamese Americans through TikTok. The primary argument is that social media plays a critical role in facilitating cultural exchange and cultivating a sense of belonging for young immigrants living far away from their ancestral homelands. The study focuses on the main theoretical discussions on culture in mediated space, migration, and media representation, as well as the construction of the youthful sense of self on social media, to guide these aims. The research questions focus on the role that TikTok plays in the formation and expression of the cultural identity of young Vietnamese immigrants and the reactions of the audience to these representations. The study uses a critical realism approach, which recognizes the importance of social environment, culture, and power relations in shaping research outcomes. The research employs a case study research method, which is useful for understanding the underlying social structures and power relations that shape the social phenomenon under investigation. Qualitative methods are used for data collection, including qualitative text analysis of TikTok videos and audience reactions, as well as netnographic observation. The researcher's involvement in collecting and analyzing the data is emphasized, as it enables the researcher to gain a unique perspective on the cultural practices of young Vietnamese Americans on TikTok. Show less

projects.name: "Coming of age at the rice wine table" - a field work study in Ha Giang, Vietnam
projects.description: Every year, a joint initiative between the Faculty of International Studies at Hanoi University and the Global Studies program at the University of Gothenburg organizes a field trip to Ha Giang province for senior students from both institutions. During this educational excursion, students engage in immersive experiences, including staying in the homes of ethnic communities and conducting interviews with local residents and authorities, when necessary. Each research team, composed of 2-3 students from diverse backgrounds, is tasked with exploring a range of societal issues such as education, gender equality, women's roles, culture, economic development, and healthcare. The goal is to gain a deeper understanding of these issues through direct interaction and research in the field. Our research team embarked on a study titled "Coming of Age at the Rice Wine Table." This qualitative field study focuses on the youth and drinking culture prevalent in the northern Vietnamese uplands. In this research, we examine the significance of drinking as a social and cultural phenomenon, emphasizing its communal aspects rather than viewing it solely as a means of intoxication.Based on observations when staying in ethnic people's houses and interviews with local people and authority (if necessary), each research team (2-3 mixed students) are supposed to conduct a research on such issues as education, gender equality, women's role, culture, economic development, health care and so on. Our research team conducted a research titled "Coming of age at the rice wine table" - a qualitative field study on youth and drinking culture in the northen Vietnamese uplands. In this study, we deal with drinking as a social and cultural factor that gains its value primarily through its collective role, as opposed to as a means of intoxication only. Show less
